info.name: LigiOpen API Collection
info.description:
# LigiOpen - Comprehensive Football League Management System for Kenya

This collection contains all API endpoints for the LigiOpen system, designed specifically for Kenya's diverse football ecosystem.

## üìã Collection Overview

### üîê Authentication & Authorization
- JWT authentication with refresh tokens
- Google OAuth2 integration
- Email verification system
- Password reset functionality

### üë§ User Profile Management
- Complete user profile CRUD operations
- Profile picture upload with Digital Ocean Spaces
- User preferences and settings management
- Account management features

## üöÄ Getting Started

### 1. Environment Setup
- Set the `base_url` variable to your server URL (default: `http://localhost:8000`)
- The `jwt_token` variable will be automatically set after login

### 2. Authentication Flow
1. **Register** a new account using the signup endpoint
2. **Verify** your email (check console logs for verification link)
3. **Login** to get JWT token (automatically saved to environment)
4. Use **protected endpoints** with the JWT token

### 3. API Testing
- All requests include proper examples and test scripts
- Environment variables are automatically managed
- Response data is validated and displayed

## üì± Base URL Structure
All endpoints follow the pattern: `{{base_url}}/api/v1/...`

## üîí Security
- JWT tokens are automatically included in protected requests
- Tokens are stored securely in environment variables
- All sensitive endpoints require authentication

---

**Version**: 1.0.0  
**Author**: LigiOpen Team  
**Documentation**: https://docs.ligiopen.com  
**Support**: support@ligiopen.com

request.description:
Register a new user account in the LigiOpen system.

### Request Body
- `username`: Unique username (3-50 characters)
- `email`: Valid email address 
- `password`: Strong password (min 8 characters)
- `firstName`: User's first name (2-50 characters)
- `lastName`: User's last name (2-50 characters)
- `phoneNumber`: Kenyan phone number format (+254...)
- `preferredLanguage`: Language preference (en/sw)

### Response
- Returns user details and success message
- Email verification will be required
- User account starts as unverified

### Next Steps
1. Check application logs for verification email link
2. Use the verification link to activate account
3. Login with credentials to get JWT token

request.description:
Authenticate user and receive JWT tokens.

### Request Body
- `email`: User's email address or username
- `password`: User's password

### Response
- `accessToken`: JWT token for API authentication (expires in 24 hours)
- `refreshToken`: Token for refreshing access token (expires in 7 days)
- `user`: User profile information

### Important Notes
- Access token is automatically stored in environment variable `jwt_token`
- Refresh token is stored in `refresh_token`
- User must have verified email to login
- Tokens are required for all protected endpoints

### Usage
The JWT token will be automatically included in subsequent requests that require authentication.

Refresh expired JWT access token using refresh token.

### Request Body
- `refreshToken`: Valid refresh token from login

### Response
- New `accessToken`: Fresh JWT token (24 hour expiry)
- New `refreshToken`: Fresh refresh token (7 day expiry)

### When to Use
- When access token expires (typically after 24 hours)
- To maintain user session without re-login
- Automatically updates environment variables

### Security Notes
- Refresh tokens are single-use and generate new tokens
- Old refresh token becomes invalid after use
- Both tokens are updated in environment automatically

Verify user's email address using verification token.

### Query Parameters
- `token`: Email verification token sent to user's email

### Process
1. User registers account
2. Verification email is sent (check application logs)
3. User clicks verification link or uses token manually
4. Account becomes verified and active

### Response
- Success message confirming email verification
- User can now login normally

### Development Note
In development, verification emails are logged to console. Check application logs for the verification link and extract the token parameter.

Resend email verification link to user's email address.

### Request Body
- `email`: User's email address that needs verification

### When to Use
- When user didn't receive initial verification email
- When verification token has expired
- When user needs a new verification link

### Response
- Success message confirming email was sent
- New verification token generated and sent

### Rate Limiting
- Limited to prevent spam
- Wait a few minutes between requests if needed

item.name: üë§ User Profile Management
item.description: Complete user profile CRUD operations including profile updates, picture uploads, and account management.

request.description:
Get the authenticated user's complete profile information.

### Authentication Required
- JWT token must be included in Authorization header
- Token is automatically included from environment variable

### Response Fields
- `id`: User's unique identifier
- `username`: User's username
- `email`: User's email address
- `firstName` & `lastName`: User's name
- `phoneNumber`: Contact number
- `bio`: User's biography/description
- `preferredLanguage`: Language preference
- `profilePictureUrl`: URL to profile picture (if uploaded)
- `emailVerified`: Email verification status
- `accountEnabled`: Account status
- `role`: User's role in the system
- `createdAt` & `updatedAt`: Timestamps
- `favoritedClubsCount`: Number of clubs favorited
- `ownedClubsCount`: Number of clubs owned
- `managedClubsCount`: Number of clubs managed

### Use Cases
- Display user information in UI
- Profile page data
- User settings initialization
- Dashboard statistics

exec: console.log('‚úÖ User profile retrieved by ID!');

request.description:
Get any user's public profile information by their user ID.

### Path Parameters
- `userId`: The unique identifier of the user whose profile to retrieve

### Authentication Required
- JWT token required for accessing user profiles
- Returns public profile information only

### Response
- Same structure as current user profile
- May have restricted information for privacy
- Useful for viewing other users' public profiles

### Use Cases
- Club member profiles
- Player profiles
- Public user directories
- Social features

### Privacy Notes
- Only public information is returned
- Some fields may be hidden based on privacy settings
- Sensitive information is never exposed

request.description:
Update the authenticated user's profile information.

### Authentication Required
- JWT token must be included in Authorization header

### Request Body (All fields optional)
- `firstName`: First name (2-50 characters)
- `lastName`: Last name (2-50 characters)
- `phoneNumber`: Phone number in international format
- `bio`: User biography/description (max 500 characters)
- `preferredLanguage`: Language preference (en/sw)

### Validation Rules
- Names must be 2-50 characters long
- Phone number must be valid international format
- Bio cannot exceed 500 characters
- Language must be 'en' or 'sw'

### Response
- Returns updated profile information
- All profile fields included in response
- Updated timestamp reflects change time

### Use Cases
- Profile editing forms
- Settings updates
- Personal information maintenance
- Language preference changes

### Important Notes
- Only provided fields are updated
- Validation errors return specific field messages
- Profile picture updated separately

formdata.description: Profile picture image file (JPG, PNG, max 10MB)

request.description:
Upload a new profile picture for the authenticated user.

### Authentication Required
- JWT token must be included in Authorization header

### Request Body (Form Data)
- `file`: Image file to upload as profile picture

### File Requirements
- **Format**: JPG, JPEG, PNG only
- **Size**: Maximum 10MB
- **Type**: Must be an image file
- **Content**: Appropriate profile picture content

### Digital Ocean Spaces Integration
- Files uploaded to Digital Ocean Spaces
- Automatic file optimization and resizing
- CDN delivery for fast loading
- Secure file storage with access controls

### Response
- `profile`: Updated user profile with new picture URL
- `fileUrl`: Direct URL to uploaded image
- `fileId`: Unique file identifier for management

### Use Cases
- Profile picture updates
- Avatar customization
- User identification
- Social profile enhancement

### Important Notes
- Previous profile picture is automatically replaced
- File is validated for type and size
- URL is immediately available for use
- Optimized for web and mobile display

### Error Handling
- Invalid file types rejected
- Oversized files rejected
- Corrupted files handled gracefully
- Detailed error messages provided

Remove the current profile picture for the authenticated user.

### Authentication Required
- JWT token must be included in Authorization header

### Action
- Removes current profile picture from user profile
- Deletes file from Digital Ocean Spaces storage
- Resets profile picture URL to null
- Cannot be undone (file is permanently deleted)

### Response
- Success message confirming removal
- Profile reverts to default/no picture state

### Use Cases
- Privacy concerns
- Profile cleanup
- Before uploading new picture
- Account management

### Important Notes
- File is permanently deleted from storage
- Profile picture URL becomes null
- Action cannot be reversed
- Does not affect other profile information

### After Removal
- User profile shows no picture
- Can upload new picture anytime
- Profile remains fully functional

request.description:
‚ö†Ô∏è **PERMANENTLY DELETE** the authenticated user's account and all associated data.

### Authentication Required
- JWT token must be included in Authorization header

### ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING - IRREVERSIBLE ACTION
This action will permanently delete:
- User account and profile
- All uploaded files and media
- Club memberships and relationships
- Favorited clubs and preferences
- All user-generated content
- Account history and statistics

### Data Deletion
- User profile completely removed
- Files deleted from Digital Ocean Spaces
- Database records permanently deleted
- No recovery possible after deletion
- Complies with data protection regulations

### Response
- Success message confirming deletion
- JWT tokens become invalid immediately
- All sessions terminated

### Use Cases
- Account closure requests
- Privacy compliance (GDPR right to erasure)
- User-initiated account deletion
- Administrative account removal

### Post-Deletion
- User cannot login with deleted credentials
- Email address becomes available for new registration
- All associated data is permanently removed
- Action cannot be undone

### Important Notes
- **This action is irreversible**
- Consider data export before deletion
- Inform user of permanent nature
- All related data is cascade deleted
- Complies with data retention policies
